Company Description

Acumatica is a leading provider of cloud business management software that empowers small and mid-size businesses to unlock their potential and drive growth. Built on the world‚Äôs best cloud and mobile technology and a unique customer-centric licensing model, Acumatica delivers a suite of fully integrated business management applications, such as Financials, Distribution, CRM, and Project Accounting, on a robust and flexible platform. In an interconnected world, Acumatica enables customers to take full control of their businesses, play to their organizations‚Äô unique strengths, and support their clients by following them anywhere on any device., and support their clients by following them anywhere on any device.

(Position can be remotely only if you are in Serbia)

¬†

About the role:

As a Senior Software Developer (with CI/CD focus too) in the Platform department, you will focus on designing, developing, and maintaining scalable enterprise software solutions. This role emphasizes hands-on coding, implementing complex business logic and all aspects of Acumatica's end-to-end CI/CD pipeline management.

You will work closely with QA engineers, business analysts, and DevOps specialists to develop high-quality software solutions that align with business needs. Additionally, you will play a key role in solving challenging technical problems and optimizing application performance to ensure a seamless user experience.



Job Description

¬†

  • Design, develop, and maintain C#-based applications and libraries.
  • Implement and optimize APIs and services to support new and existing features.
  • Collaborate with product managers and QA teams to ensure feature requirements are met and properly tested.
  • Analyze and resolve performance bottlenecks and scalability issues.
  • Integrate with third-party systems and APIs to expand application capabilities.
  • Develop unit and integration tests to ensure code quality and maintainability.
  • Participate in architectural discussions and propose solutions for complex problems.
  • Automate deployment processes, including CI/CD pipeline implementation, maintenance, and optimization.
  • Analyze build and deployment failures, identify root causes, and implement solutions to enhance system stability.


Qualifications

¬†

  • 3+ years of experience in C# application development and .NET frameworks (e.g., .NET Core, .NET Framework).
  • Proficiency in scripting or programming languages such as PowerShell, Bash.
  • Expertise in designing and implementing APIs (REST, SOAP) and working with API integration tools.
  • Proficiency in modern design patterns and principles such as SOLID, DI, etc.
  • Experience with relational databases such as Microsoft SQL Server, PostgreSQL, or MySQL.
  • Strong knowledge of Git and version control workflows, including experience with platforms like Atlassian Bitbucket.
  • Experience working with CI/CD pipelines and tools such as Jenkins, Atlassian Bamboo, GitHub Actions, or Azure DevOps.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to software development challenges.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.

¬†

Nice to have:

  • Experience with ERP, CRM, or other enterprise software systems.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS or Azure and containerization technologies such as Docker.
  • Knowledge of Node.Js and its ecosystem.
  • Familiarity with API testing tools like Postman or cURL.


Additional Information

¬†

  • Good relocation package (we help people to relocate to Serbia and handle the whole process)
  • Private health insurance
  • Many vacation days
  • Performance bonuses
  • Full work equipment
  • Great opportunities for career growth

descripcion:
Apply
Description

Job Type: Full-time
Location: U.S. or Canada (Preferred regions: West Coast/Central US, Central/Western Canada)
Department: Technical Support

About CloudBees

CloudBees is the leading software delivery platform enabling enterprises to scale software delivery while ensuring security, compliance, and operational efficiency. We empower developers with fast, self-serve workflows across hybrid and heterogeneous environments, offering unmatched flexibility for cloud transformation.

As trusted partners in DevSecOps, CloudBees supports organizations using Jenkins on-premise, transitioning to the cloud, or accelerating their DevOps maturity to drive innovation and achieve their business goals.

Role Overview

As a Development Support Engineer (DSE) at CloudBees, you will play a critical role in supporting our customers‚Äô DevOps environments. You‚Äôll troubleshoot complex issues, guide best practices, and collaborate across teams to ensure customer success. This role combines technical acumen, problem-solving skills, and customer empathy to create an exceptional support experience that drives customer satisfaction and loyalty.

In addition to direct customer interaction, you‚Äôll contribute to internal tools and knowledge-sharing initiatives that enhance team efficiency. If you thrive on solving technical puzzles and enjoy working in a collaborative environment, this role is for you.

Key Responsibilities

  • Technical Support:
    • Diagnose and resolve technical issues with products and integrations, including Jenkins, Kubernetes, Docker, and CI/CD pipelines
    • Provide recommendations for best practices in DevOps workflows
    • Assist with complex setup, configuration, and troubleshooting of tools and environments
  • Customer Engagement:
    • Respond to customer inquiries via a ticketing system, email, and occasionally phone for urgent issues
    • Actively engage with customers to understand their challenges and provide tailored solutions.
    • Contribute to documentation and knowledge bases to ensure customers can self-serve when possible
  • Collaboration & Tools Development:
    • Work closely with Engineering, Product, and DevOps teams to escalate and resolve issues effectively
    • Develop and enhance internal tools for automating diagnostics and improving team efficiency
  • Continuous Learning:
    • Stay updated on evolving DevOps tools, cloud platforms, and software development trends
    • Participate in team scrums and collaborative problem-solving sessions


Requirements

QualificationsMust-Have:

  • 5+ years experience in Java Application troubleshooting performing JVM analysis using thread dumps, heap dumps, and garbage collector logs
  • 1-2+ years experience working with Jenkins as an admin/developing jobs/troubleshooting builds
  • 5+ years experience in Linux system administration and troubleshooting
  • Hands-on experience with DevOps tools like Kubernetes, Docker, and Git
  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and related concepts
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently
  • Strong communication skills, with fluency in English (written and verbal)

Nice-to-Have:

  • Proficiency in Java development
  • Experience with enterprise technologies like LDAP, databases, and REST APIs.
  • Cloud platform expertise (AWS, GCP, Azure)
  • Certifications in Kubernetes, cloud platforms, or DevOps-related tools
  • Open source contributions or Jenkins community involvement
  • Previous experience in a customer-facing technical support role

Why Join CloudBees?

  • Generous PTO to recharge and spend time with loved ones
  • A culture of inclusivity, innovation, and global diversity
  • Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and contribute to DevSecOps transformation
  • Collaborative environment with opportunities for growth and skill development

CloudBees Commitment to Diversity: ¬†We believe diversity drives innovation and enables us to serve our global customers better. We are committed to fostering a workplace that reflects the diversity of the Jenkins community and the customers we support.Note: Beware of recruitment scams. CloudBees does not request sensitive personal or financial information during the hiring process.Join us and help shape the future of DevSecOps!
tecnologias: Java, Go, Scala, Rust, R, AWS, Azure, GCP, Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, AI, DevOps, CI/CD, Scrum, REST, API, Excel, Git, Linux

This description is a summary of our understanding of the job description. Click on 'Apply' button to find out more.

Role Description

As a Staff Site Reliability Engineer (Staff SRE) at SailPoint, you will be a key member on our Reliability Engineering team, driving reliability practices servicing the Identity Security Cloud platform. You are immensely passionate about reliability practices and operational excellence.

  • Make it easy for everyone to create, consume, manage, and scale reliable cloud production services to achieve more
  • Keep up with industry trends to improve end-to-end reliability and maintainability for all services
  • Coach engineering teams on observability best practices such as setting up well-defined Service Level Objectives (SLOs)
  • Analyze performance of services and recommend infrastructure/code changes that will improve capacity and performance
  • Enable our engineering teams to scale our enterprise operations by providing guidance, best practices, and support as part of an SRE Center of Excellence
  • Manage cross-functional requirements working with Engineering, Product, Services, and other departments
  • Be a mentor of quality for design reviews, code, test cases, automation, observability, root cause analysis, and self-healing
  • Influence architectural design, implementation, consolidation, and simplification for global scale
  • Drive operational excellence to deliver frictionless operation, happy on call, and optimal customer experience

Qualifications

  • 8+ years experience in SRE or DevOps production operations supporting a highly available environment for SaaS software or cloud service provider
  • Strong proficiency with one or more programming languages (Java, Python, Go, etc.)
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or other technical discipline, or equivalent experience is preferred, not required

Requirements

  • Due to FedRAMP requirements, US Citizenship is required to be considered for this role
  • Experience with cloud infrastructure environments, preferably AWS, and Infrastructure as code, preferably Terraform
  • Strong proficiency with containerization technology and/or Kubernetes
  • In-depth experience with metrics, tracing, and logging observability tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, Honeycomb, and Kibana
  • Experience with incident management, including conducting incident reviews
  • Strong understanding of Linux, software development, systems, networking, and Cloud concepts
  • A positive and collaborative demeanor, combined with the ability to coach, mentor, and delegate
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Life-long learner ‚Äì you stay up to date with technology trends, spend time learning new technologies, and share your learnings with your team

Benefits

  • Health and wellness coverage: Medical, dental, and vision insurance
  • Disability coverage: Short-term and long-term disability
  • Life protection: Life insurance and Accidental Death & Dismemberment (AD&D)
  • Flexible spending accounts for health care, and dependent care; limited purpose flexible spending account
  • Financial security: 401(k) Savings and Investment Plan with company matching
  • Time off benefits: Flexible vacation policy
  • Holidays: 8 paid holidays annually
  • Sick leave
  • Parental support: Paid parental leave
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP) and Care Counselors
  • Voluntary benefits: Legal Assistance, Critical Illness, Accident, Hospital Indemnity and Pet Insurance options
  • Health Savings Account (HSA) with employer contribution

descripcion:
Orion Innovation is a premier, award-winning, global business and technology services firm.¬† Orion delivers game-changing business transformation and product development rooted in digital strategy, experience design, and engineering, with a unique combination of agility, scale, and maturity.¬† We work with a wide range of clients across many industries including financial services, professional services, telecommunications and media, consumer products, automotive, industrial automation, professional sports and entertainment, life sciences, ecommerce, and education.

We are looking for a Zephyr (Ztest) Automation Senior QA Engineer who has min. 5 years hands on experience with Python language by taking the ownership and proactively drives all aspects of automating test scenarios that check the functionality of the related product.

¬†

Required skills:

  • Spoken English is must for daily meetings with foreign team members and customers.
  • Strong knowledge in test automation with Zephyr (Ztest).
  • Strong knowledge in test automation with Python.
  • Recent hands-on experience in writing test cases with Zephyr tool.
  • 5+ years of experience in developing test automation frameworks, QA engineering, software testing processes and methods.
  • Experience in code debugging. What is a breakpoint, how to debug.
  • Experience in REST API testing, creating API and integration tests.
  • Ability to work through the UI or through the console with the simplest commands in Git: amend, git fetch, pull, checkout.
  • Excellent understanding of testing methodologies, quality assurance strategies, test planning, test case preparation, defect management, system dependencies and product integration phases.
  • Good understanding of testing concepts, STLC and the role of QA in the software development lifecycle.
  • Good communication skills, willingness/ability to work in a team.
  • Experienced with CI/CD pipelines like Azure Devops and GitLab.
  • Good understanding of Agile Methodology.

Main Responsibilities:

  • Able to advise and provide leadership to QA team and clients on approaches to test automation framework as a senior QA engineer.
  • Taking responsibilities of test automation structure.
  • Building and maintaining the test automation pipelines and infrastructure.
  • Designing, developing and maintaining test automation scenarios.
  • Executing automated test scenarios for functionality, regression, integration, etc.
  • Creating test plans which include change request details. Testing Schedule, Testing Resources, Testing Strategy, Required Tools and Risks.
  • Gathering test requirements and producing test specifications.
  • Analyzing and reporting the test results and logging test outcomes.
  • Working within an agile team.
  • Contributing to Test Automation Chapters actively by defining standards, sharing issues and challenges.

Will be a plus:

  • Recent hands-on experience in Golang programming language.
  • Networking experience.
  • Understanding how to run a Jenkins job, what a job is, what parameters a job can take, how to set build parameters, what a build is, how to read build logs.
  • Experience in IDE (WebStorm/IntellijIDEA/Eclipse).
  • Knowledge of Linux and command line shell scripting.
  • Knowledge of relational databases, strong SQL skills.

Company Description

Accesa is a leading technology company headquartered in Cluj-Napoca, with offices in Oradea, Bucharest, Timisoara and 20 years of experience in turning business challenges into opportunities and growth.

A value-driven organisation, it has established itself as a partner of choice for major brands in Retail, Manufacturing, Finance, and Banking. It covers the complete digital evolution journey of its customers, from ideation and requirements setup to software development and managed services solutions.

With more than 1,200 IT professionals, Accesa also has a fast-growing footprint, establishing itself as an employer of choice for IT professionals who are passionate about problem-solving through technology. Coming together in strong tech teams with a customer-centric approach, they enable businesses to grow, delivering value for our clients, partners, industry, and community.



Job Description

Our client is a leading German asset management company which provides tailored asset management solutions, including mutual funds and pensions, focusing on sustainability, transparency, and delivering value to clients.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, implement, and maintain scalable CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins and GitLab (migration in progress) to streamline software delivery.

  • Support development teams in software deployment processes across OpenShift environments using Docker and Helm.

  • Monitor system performance, manage dashboards with Grafana/Prometheus, and ensure robust observability and incident response.

  • Automate infrastructure and software installation routines, contributing to system reliability and repeatability.

  • Manage secure handling of certificates, secrets, and credentials through Vault and enforce best practices in operational security.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to troubleshoot, optimize, and improve microservices-based architecture and communication workflows.¬†



Qualifications
  • 4+ years of experience in¬†system operations (Linux), focusing on modern tech stacks, CI/CD pipelines, and efficient cloud operations (preferably on Microsoft Azure)
  • Proficiency with CI/CD tools such as Azure DevOps or GitLab CI/CD
  • Expertise in building and managing containers (Docker) on Kubernetes clusters (AKS)
  • Advanced knowledge of Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) tools like Terraform or Bicep for reusable and scalable infrastructure management
  • Strong scripting skills (e.g., Python, Bash) for automation and optimization
  • Familiarity with the Azure Advanced Analytics/AI stack and service meshes in Kubernetes
  • Analytical mindset with a proactive approach to problem-solving
  • Resilient, reliable, and capable of working effectively under pressure
  • Strong organizational, interpersonal, and communication abilities
  • Fluent English and German language skills

¬†

  • Experience with Java development (Spring Boot, JUnit, TDD) is a plus, aiding in better collaboration with development teams and understanding of application internals


Additional Information

At Accesa you can:

Enjoy our holistic benefits program that covers the four pillars that we believe come together to support our wellbeing, covering social, physical, emotional wellbeing, as well as work-life fusion.

  • Physical: premium medical package for both our colleagues and their children, dental coverage up to a yearly amount, eyeglasses reimbursement every two years, voucher for sport equipment expenses, in-house personal trainer
  • Emotional: individual therapy sessions with a certified psychotherapist, webinars on self-development topics
  • Social: virtual activities, sports challenges, special occasions get-togethers
  • Work-life fusion: yearly increase in days off, flexible working schedule, birthday, holiday and loyalty gifts for major milestones
tecnologias: Python, Java, Scala, R, Spring, Azure, Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, GitLab, Terraform, AI, DevOps, CI/CD, REST, Microservices, API, SPA, TDD, Git, Linux

descripcion:
Yalo

Hi! We‚Äôre Yalo! We‚Äôre on a mission to revolutionize how businesses sell in an omnichannel way with our intelligent sales platform and intelligent agents powered by cutting-edge AI.¬†Imagine a world where businesses seamlessly connect with their customers across every channel‚Äîoffering personalized experiences, anticipating needs, and delivering what they want with ease. That‚Äôs the reality we‚Äôre building at Yalo.


Born in Latin America and driven by its spirit of innovation, we‚Äôre transforming sales for businesses around the globe. From empowering businesses in emerging markets to helping enterprises scale intelligently, we‚Äôre redefining how companies engage with their customers and drive growth.


At Yalo, we believe the future of sales is personalized, omnichannel, intelligent, and conversational. Join us as we empower businesses to build stronger relationships and achieve remarkable results worldwide!

¬†

Job Summary üßæ

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior DevOps Engineer to join our dynamic team. This role involves designing, implementing, and managing scalable, reliable, and secure cloud infrastructure, with a focus on Kubernetes (K8s), Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Argo, cloud architecture, and Kafka. The ideal candidate will also have experience in cost optimization and proficiency in coding with Python, JavaScript, or other programming languages.

¬†

Your mission?

The main objective of this role is to ensure the efficient and reliable operation of our cloud infrastructure, enabling seamless integration and deployment of applications. This role is key to maintaining our competitive edge by optimizing performance, enhancing security, and reducing costs. Additionally, you will play a crucial role in promoting a DevOps culture across the organization, fostering collaboration between teams, and contributing to architectural decisions.

¬†

What are the responsibilities for this role?¬†üß†

    • Design, implement, and manage scalable, reliable, and secure cloud infrastructure on GCP.
    • Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines using Argo to ensure efficient and automated deployment processes.
    • Manage and optimize Kubernetes clusters for high availability and performance.
    • Architect and implement cloud solutions that meet business requirements and industry best practices.
    • Integrate and manage Kafka for real-time data processing and streaming applications.
    • Collaborate with development teams to ensure seamless integration and deployment of applications.
    • Monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and implement improvements to enhance system reliability and efficiency.
    • Implement cost optimization strategies to ensure efficient use of cloud resources and reduce operational expenses.
    • Promote DevOps best practices and culture across the organization.
    • Work closely with cross-functional teams to drive architectural decisions and ensure alignment with business goals.

¬†

Job Requirements?üíª

    • Proven experience as a DevOps Engineer or similar role.
    • Extensive experience with Kubernetes, GCP, Argo, cloud architecture, and Kafka.
    • Proficiency in coding with Python, JavaScript, or other programming languages.
    • Strong understanding of CI/CD principles and best practices.
    • Experience in cost optimization and managing cloud budgets.
    • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
    • Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.
    • Strong communication skills and the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

¬†

Soft Skills that matter to usü´Ä

    • Time management
    • Strong communication skills
    • Adaptability and flexibility
    • Team collaboration
    • Mentorship

¬†

Metrics to measure¬†üìà

    • System uptime and reliability
    • Deployment frequency and success rate
    • Cost savings and budget adherence
    • Response time to incidents
    • Performance improvements and optimization metrics
    • Adoption of DevOps practices across teams

¬†

What do we offer? ü•∞
  • Unlimited PTO policy
  • Competitive rewards on the market range
  • Worklife-Personal Life Integration
  • Start-up environment
  • International teamwork
  • You and nothing else limit your career here

¬†

We care,
We keep it simple,
We make it happen,
We strive for excellence.

¬†

At Yalo, we are dedicated to creating a workplace that embodies our core values: caring, initiative, excellence, and simplicity. We believe in the power of diversity and inclusivity, where everyone's unique perspectives, experiences, and talents contribute to our collective success. As we embrace and respect our differences, we strive to create something extraordinary for the benefit of all.
We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, providing equal opportunities to individuals regardless of race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic. Our commitment to fairness and equality is a fundamental pillar of our company.


At Yalo, we uphold a culture of excellence. We constantly challenge ourselves to go above and beyond, delivering remarkable results and driving innovation. We encourage each team member to take initiative and make things happen, empowering them to bring their best ideas forward and contribute to our shared goals.

Company Description

Scalable Capital is a leading digital investment platform in Europe. The company empowers everyone to shape their financial future. Scalable Broker makes it easy and affordable for clients to invest professionally in stocks, ETFs and other exchange-traded products and set up savings plans. Scalable Wealth, the digital wealth management service, offers clients professional investment in ETF portfolios and is also adopted as a white-label solution by renowned B2B partners. With the European Investor Exchange (EIX) Scalable Capital offers a stock exchange for retail investors in Europe. Over 27 billion euro is held on the platform by more than one million clients.

Scalable Capital was founded in 2014 and employs more than 500 people at its offices in Munich, Berlin, Vienna, and London. Together with the founding and management team around Erik Podzuweit and Florian Prucker, they are working on a new generation of financial services.

Visit our finance blog or check out our Social Media channels to find out what our Expert Teams have to say.

Our Company Values guide us every day in how we work and collaborate. To learn more about them, you can find our values here (English).



Job Description

Shape the future of Scalable‚Äôs new fully vertically integrated investment platform. Scalable‚Äôs Broker, digital Wealth Management, and Credit offerings are seamlessly integrated into a newly developed technology platform.

As a Frontend Engineer, you will be a key member of one of our product teams responsible for designing and building powerful, intuitive UIs that support critical back-office processes, from transaction monitoring to corporate action workflows and operational dashboards. Our frontend stack is built on React and TypeScript, with strong foundations in component reuse, design systems, and testable architecture.

While these applications aren‚Äôt customer-facing, they are essential to delivering high-quality service to our clients. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with internal stakeholders to understand complex workflows and translate them into well-structured, maintainable user interfaces.

This role is a great fit if you care about clean UX even in utility-driven environments, enjoy working closely with backend and platform engineers, and want to make a direct impact on the scalability and efficiency of a fast-growing fintech company.

  • You work with cutting-edge technologies and participate in modern software development practices (e.g., agile and self-managed teams, continuous integration and deployment, test automation, cloud-based infrastructure, and tooling).
  • Engage with our cloud-native, DevOps-enabled infrastructure, utilizing AWS services like ECS, Fargate, and Lambda.
  • You write clean, testable, maintainable, and well-documented code and treat security as a first-class citizen
  • You bring products to production and reveal real business value
  • You can improve engineering excellence in the team


Qualifications
  • A university degree in a relevant field of study (e.g., computer science, engineering) or a comparable qualification
  • 3+ years of frontend experience in technologies like Typescript, React, NextJs, Cypress, WebPack, Material Design, Express, HTML5, CSS3
  • A strong passion for outstanding UI/UX, web performance, and accessibility
  • Ability to think outside the box and to work independently¬†
  • Analytical proficiency, both in the technical and in the product domain
  • Excellent communication skills that are clear, concise, and targeted towards your audience - engineering, product, or other stakeholders
  • Practical experience in AWS or another cloud provider
  • Professional proficiency in English


Additional Information
  • Be part of one of the fastest-growing and most visible Fintech startups in Europe, creating innovative services that have a substantial impact on the lives of our customers
  • Work with an international, diverse, inclusive, and ever-growing team that loves creating the best products for our clients
  • Work from our centrally located offices in the heart of Munich or Berlin, nestled in lively neighborhoods filled with vibrant restaurants, cozy caf√©s, and a wide range of convenient amenities or choose to work remotely within Germany¬†(if eligible for the job)
  • Be productive with the latest hardware and tools
  • Learn and grow by joining our in-house knowledge sharing sessions and spending your individual Education Budget¬†
  • Learn and experience German culture first hand by joining our free German language classes
  • (International) relocation support
  • Flexible vacation policy and the opportunity to work from abroad
  • Benefit from an attractive compensation package and from the company pension scheme
  • Monthly contribution of 25% for the ‚ÄòDeutschland Jobticket‚Äô
  • Say goodbye to order commissions and say hello to your complimentary subscription of Scalable Capital's PRIME+ Broker

Plus, our Accounts Management team ensures smooth, effective client relationships, so you can focus on what you do best.¬†

Ready to grow with us? üöÄ¬†

¬†

¬†
About the project¬†
¬†
As a Senior¬†DevOps Engineer - Python, you will play a key role in automating and monitoring deployments using CI/CD pipelines, ensuring the platform is reliable, scalable, and secure. Experience with ECS, Lambda, and containerized environments is essential, and familiarity with Databricks is a bonus.¬†

¬†

This would make you the ideal candidate¬†

descripcion:
Who we are:

AlphaSights is the leading global knowledge platform. Our sophisticated technology platform enables our clients, our people, and our experts to connect, collaborate, and transfer globally distributed knowledge faster than ever before. Professionals at investment firms, consultancies, corporations and nonprofits rely on us to connect them seamlessly with knowledgeable domain experts who help enhance their thinking, inform critical decisions and propel their business forward. Founded in 2008, AlphaSights currently employs more than 1,500 professionals in nine offices around the globe and regularly ranks as one of the fastest-growing companies in the world.

The role:

AlphaSights' Infrastructure Engineers work hard to make sure we‚Äôre performant, highly available and resilient to failures. As an infra engineer, you will be responsible for planning, building and maintaining our core AWS infrastructure and our CI/CD pipelines and toolset.¬†

We're looking for people who are interested in designing and executing solutions to a very high standard, comfortable working across multiple technologies, and learn quickly when new ones are introduced. We care more about your engineering skill versus your deep knowledge of a particular tool, provider or technology.

What you‚Äôll do:

  • Create solutions that enable our engineering teams to deploy code quickly, reliably and securely
  • Ensure the availability, scalability, performance and security of our cloud infrastructure
  • Diagnose and troubleshoot application and infrastructure related issues quickly and effectively
  • Provision cloud resources based on capacity, computing and security requirements
  • Always have best security practices top of mind, employing zero trust and principle of least privilege across all critical systems and resources
  • Work in tandem with development teams to manage and execute DevOps and Infrastructure initiatives
  • Regularly evaluate and research alternative solutions to improve internal DevOps processes
  • Continuously evaluate and refine the monitoring of our critical infrastructure and applications

Who you are:

  • You probably have a degree in a STEM subject, but we‚Äôre happy to work with people who perfected their craft via a different route.
  • 2+ years experience in demonstrating¬†competency and positive results in a DevOps, SRE or Infrastructure Engineering role.
  • 2+ years experience¬†managing and demonstrating competency with AWS infrastructure, including EKS, RDS, S3, and others as well as professional experience with CI/CD tooling and concepts.
  • Experience working at a similar level in an Engineering team, and looking to take your career to the next level. We‚Äôre looking for people who have incredible potential.
  • Proven track record ‚Äì You‚Äôve made a demonstrable impact in your previous roles, standing out from your peers.¬†
  • Highly driven and proactive ‚Äì you relentlessly and independently push through hurdles and drive towards excellent outcomes.
  • Meticulous ‚Äì you hold high standards and have an obsessive attention to detail.

Learn more about our tech organisation here.

Don‚Äôt worry if your experience or background doesn‚Äôt match all of these areas, we believe a broad spectrum of experience provides great perspective on solving problems in new and innovative ways and we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

AlphaSights is an equal opportunity employer.

*THIS IS A REMOTE POSITION EXCLUSIVELY FOR CURRENT BRAZILIAN RESIDENTS.
tecnologias: Scala, Rust, R, AWS, AI, DevOps, CI/CD, REST, API, Excel

descripcion:
üëã¬†About¬†Owner.com
Owner is the all-in-one platform that restaurants use to succeed online.

Thousands of restaurant owners use our tools to build their website, drive online orders, create their own branded app, manage their customer relationships, and set up marketing automations.

You can think of it as Shopify meets HubSpot, but specifically for restaurants.

Learn more about the problems we are solving for our customers¬†here.

üåé¬†Our vision
We‚Äôre starting by helping independent restaurants succeed online.

But it‚Äôs not just restaurants that need our help. Most local businesses are struggling with these same problems. Huge technology corporations are taking their customers, bleeding their profits, and making it hard for them to survive.

Once we nail the solution for restaurants¬†‚Äì¬†we‚Äôll scale it into every other local business type.

In the future we envision, tens of millions of local business owners will use our technology to succeed in the digital age.

üöÄ¬†Our traction
In just over 3 years we've generated¬†tens of millions in revenue, served millions of guests, and processed hundreds of millions of online orders.

More importantly, we‚Äôve helped thousands of restaurant owners save their businesses - and not¬† only survive, but thrive.

‚≠ê¬†Our team
Our team grew from under 100 to nearly 200 talented people in 2024. We‚Äôve got top talent from the most successful companies in SMB software, including: Shopify, HubSpot, DoorDash, ServiceTitan, Rappi, Faire and Stripe.

We‚Äôll be scaling even faster in 2025 to keep pace with our customer growth.

üåÜ¬†Where we work
Owner is a remote-first, global company headquartered in San Francisco, with a sales hub in Toronto. For a few of our roles we prioritize in-person collaboration at one of our office locations. Most of our employees are distributed throughout the globe. Please review the role description and discuss with your recruiter for more details on location!

üîç Why we‚Äôre looking for you
Owner‚Äôs restaurant-commerce platform is growing fast, and our infrastructure needs to grow even faster. We‚Äôre looking for a mission-driven Senior SRE/DevOps Engineer to keep our systems always-on, observable, and deploy-ready while helping developers ship with confidence. You‚Äôll split your time between site-reliability engineering (designing for uptime, performance, and resiliency) and DevOps enablement (tooling, CI/CD, and automation).

Your work will directly power the websites, ordering flows, payments, and mobile apps that thousands of restaurants-and millions of diners-depend on every day.

Our Stack
Infrastructure & Ops: AWS, Terraform, ECS/Fargate, Postgres, MongoDB, Kafka, Datadog, Cloudflare, GitHub, Buildkite
Backend:¬†Node.js, TypeScript, NestJS, Mikro-ORM
Frontend: React, React Native, Vue.js
(You don‚Äôt need to know every tool--depth in similar technologies is great.)


üí• The impact you will have
  • Design for reliability: Set SLOs/SLIs, build self-healing architectures, and drive incident-prevention projects that keep our APIs and real-time ordering flows <100 ms p95.
  • Own observability: Level-up dashboards, alerts, and distributed tracing so teams can detect issues before customers do.
  • Automate deployments: Evolve our Buildkite pipelines and Terraform modules to give engineers <10-minute, one-click rollouts (and clean rollbacks).
  • Champion security & compliance: Harden infra with least-privilege IAM, threat-model topology changes, and guide SOC 2 / PCI efforts.
  • Partition & scale data-stores: Tune Postgres for multi-TB workloads, maintain Mongo sharding, and shepherd Kafka topic management as event volume climbs.
  • Lead incident response: Rotate with the on-call SREs, run blameless post-mortems, and convert findings into durable fixes.
  • Mentor & collaborate: Pair with product engineers on capacity reviews, guide junior devs on Docker best-practices, and evangelize ‚Äúyou build it, you run it.‚Äù


    • ü§ù Who you‚Äôll work with
  • Partners daily with backend, frontend, and data engineers across three time-zones
  • Collaborates with Product, Customer Support, and Restaurant Success teams to keep the customer experience seamless


    • ‚úÖ Minimum requirements
  • 5+ years running production workloads on AWS (or GCP/Azure) with infrastructure-as-code (Terraform/CDK/CloudFormation)
  • Hands-on experience operating container orchestration (ECS, EKS, Kubernetes, Nomad, etc.) and designing blue/green or canary rollouts
  • Depth in at least two of our core datastores (Postgres, MongoDB, Kafka) including backup/restore, upgrades, and performance tuning
  • Fluency with CI/CD pipelines (we use Buildkite + GitHub Actions) and a knack for automating everything with shell, Python, or TypeScript
  • Proven track record setting up monitoring/alerting in Datadog, Prometheus, or similar, with clear SLO/SLA ownership
  • Strong grasp of linux networking, load balancing (Cloudflare/ELB), and CDN/edge-security concepts
  • Excellent incident-management and root-cause analysis skills; able to write crisp RCAs and follow through on action items
  • Passion for customer-centric thinking, rapid iteration, and continuous learning


    • üåü Bonus points
  • Experience with NestJS or other Node.js backends at scale
  • Prior work in PCI-DSS or SOC 2 environments
  • Familiarity with GitOps workflows (Argo CD, Flux)
  • Exposure to mobile CI (React-Native pipelines), LaunchDarkly/feature-flags, or chaos-engineering


    • üèÜ Pay & benefits
  • The estimated base salary range for this role is $170K - $210K, plus a generous pre-IPO equity package.
  • 100% remote across the U.S. or Canada (option to drop into our SF office)
  • Comprehensive health, dental, and vision coverage
  • Home-office stipend, top-tier laptop, and any tools you need to excel
  • Twice-annual team off-sites

    • üö© Notice - Employment Scams
    Communication from our team regarding job opportunities will only be made by an Owner employee with an @owner.com email address.
    We do not conduct interviews over email or chat platforms, and we will never ask you to provide personal or financial information such as your mailing address, social security number, credit card numbers or banking information.¬† If you believe you are being contacted by scammer, please mark the communication as "phishing" or ‚Äúspam‚Äù and do not respond.

descripcion:
This description is a summary of our understanding of the job description. Click on 'Apply' button to find out more.

Role Description

Your Responsibilities:

  • You will configure network access and permissions for Wiz deployments across RA's vast cloud environments.
  • You will define and configure firewall rules, security groups, and IAM permissions to allow secure access to cloud resources and APIs to integrate Wiz into the environment.
  • You will configure data collection and scanning connectors to allow the flow of relevant information, including VPC flow logs, NSG flow logs, CloudTrail, Azure Monitor Agent, and FW logs.
  • You will define and deploy security policies to multiple cloud environments.
  • You will perform testing and validation of Wiz deployment and integration into the environments.
  • You will onboard IT Security & Application Teams.
  • You will collaborate with teams to integrate Wiz with existing tooling and workflows.
  • You will define templates and standards for application and IT Security teams within Wiz to ensure ease of use during team onboarding.
  • You will provide integration and automation support to integrate existing 3rd party or custom tools used for incident management or alerting and notifications (Service Now/PagerDuty).
  • You will create IIQ roles specific to each application team to allow seamless access and onboarding.
  • You will provide training and documentation on the use of Wiz and capabilities to educate and train application teams and accelerate the value.
  • You will support integration and automation of Wiz DevOps and Container security capabilities into development team workflows (GitHub Ent, Azure DevOps, GitLab) integration with pipelines.
  • You will support the creation and integration of SPNs/IAM users to allow the automated DevOps and container security capabilities.
  • You will assist teams with existing tooling (such as PrismaCloud) migrate to Wiz.
  • You will conduct discovery and analysis phase to determine the depth of use and integration with existing tooling.
  • You will develop a migration path and plan to the team.
  • You will work with the teams to migrate to Wiz and adjust their integration points to Wiz capabilities.
  • You will configure and maintain automation supporting endpoint security tooling requirements.

Qualifications

  • Engineering bachelor's degree

Requirements

  • 2 to 3 years of experience with tools like Terraform, Artifactory, JFrog, GitHub, Wiz, Azure.
  • 2 to 3 years of previous hands-on experience using PowerShell and Python.

Benefits

  • Comprehensive mindfulness programs with a premium membership to Calm.
  • Volunteer Paid Time off available after 6 months of employment for eligible employees.
  • Company volunteer and donation matching program ‚Äì Your volunteer hours or personal cash donations to an eligible charity can be matched with a charitable donation.
  • Employee Assistance Program.
  • Personalized wellbeing programs through our OnTrack program.
  • On-demand digital course library for professional development.
  • Other local benefits!
  • Will work hybrid from Colombia or Mexico.
  • Will report to a Technical Leader.
tecnologias: Python, R, Azure, GitLab, Terraform, AI, DevOps, API, Git

descripcion:
At Agile Defense we know that action defines the outcome and new challenges require new solutions. That‚Äôs why we always look to the future and embrace change with an unmovable spirit and the courage to build for what comes next.

Our vision is to bring adaptive innovation to support our nation's most important missions through the seamless integration of advanced technologies, elite minds, and unparalleled agility‚Äîleveraging a foundation of speed, flexibility, and ingenuity to strengthen and protect our nation‚Äôs vital interests.

Overview:
Agile Defense is looking for a¬†DevOps Engineer¬†to be part of a growing¬†team¬†in the federal sector.

This candidate must have excellent written and oral communication skills and be adaptive to the changing needs of the organization. This candidate must have experience with building and maintaining highly effective relationships with team members and multiple stakeholders across multiple projects. The Developer shall be responsible for the development, testing, and maintenance of automation scripts, infrastructure tools, DSLs CI/CD pipelines utilizing Ruby and related technologies.
¬†
Clearance:¬†¬†
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† DHSUSCIS Public Trust (Level 6)


Responsibilities/Duties
  • Engage in and improve the whole lifecycle of services‚Äîfrom inception and design, through deployment, operation and refinement to efficiently deliver solutions frequently with quality.¬†
  • Write code, building infrastructure as code, work with immutable ‚Äúcloud‚Äù based environments, and build the supporting automated toolsets to test and deploy the systems they develop.¬†
  • As an DevOps engineer, analyze, design and implement strategies for continuous deployments while ensuring high availability on the development, pre-production and production environments.¬†
  • Maintain services (and supporting cloud infrastructure) once they are live by measuring and monitoring availability, latency and overall system health.¬†
  • Establish strategy/toolset/framework for automating testing of services and products, develop best practices for test automation and develop test suites.
  • Design, develop and implement solutions based on a set of standards and processes which establish consistency across the enterprise data, reduce risk, and promote efficiencies in support of the organization‚Äôs goals and objectives
  • Develops and provides training as needed
  • Develops technical documentation as needed


    • Required Qualifications
  • A Bachelor of Science (BS) degree in related field or equivalent work experience can be substituted instead of a degree.¬†
  • At least 4+ years of experience in CI/CD pipelines (Ansible, Jenkins, sonarqube, sonartype nexus, etc.) and infrastructure development (AWS, cloud formation, Terraform, RDS), windows build automation, windows system administration.¬†
  • At least 4 years of experience with revision code source code repositories in particular git and SVN¬†
  • At least 4 years of experience with strong and evolving competence in several programming languages and technologies, working knowledge of multiple tools sets, technologies and implementation environments¬†
  • At least 4 years of experience and understanding of typical three-tier enterprise application architectures¬†
  • At least 4 years of experience of practical Linux based systems administration skills and scripting experience in a Cloud-based environment.¬†
  • At least 4 years of experience with automating processes with one or more scripting languages such as ruby, Bash, and/or Python.¬†
  • Must be a US citizen.¬†


    • Preferred Qualifications
  • USCIS or DHS Experience
    • Employees of Agile Defense are our number one priority, and the importance we place on our culture here is fundamental. Our culture is alive and evolving, but it always stays true to its roots. Here, you are valued as a family member, and we believe that we can accomplish great things together. Agile Defense has been highly successful in the past few years due to our employees and the culture we create together.¬†

    What makes us Agile? We call it the 6Hs, the values that define our culture and guide everything we do. Together, these values infuse vibrancy, integrity, and a tireless work ethic into advancing the most important national security and critical civilian missions. It's how we show up every day. It's who we are.

    We also believe in supporting our employees by offering a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. To explore the benefits we offer, please visit our website under the Careers section.

    Happy¬†- Be Infectious.
    Happiness multiplies and creates a positive and connected environment where motivation and satisfaction have an outsized effect on everything we do.

    Helpful¬†- Be Supportive.
    Being helpful is the foundation of teamwork, resulting in a supportive atmosphere where collaboration flourishes, and collective success is celebrated.

    Honest¬†- Be Trustworthy.
    Honesty serves as our compass, ensuring transparent communication and ethical conduct, essential to who we are and the complex domains we support.

    Humble¬†- Be Grounded.
    Success is not achieved alone, humility ensures a culture of mutual respect, encouraging open communication, and a willingness to learn from one another and take on any task.

    Hungry¬†- Be Eager.
    Our hunger for excellence drives an insatiable appetite for innovation and continuous improvement, propelling us forward in the face of new and unprecedented challenges.

    Hustle¬†- Be Driven.
    Hustle is reflected in our relentless work ethic, where we are each committed to going above and beyond to advance the mission and achieve success.

    Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

descripcion:
Paired is a global staffing and recruiting agency that pairs remote work with top-tier talent. We help individuals from around the world connect with great companies that are looking for their specific skill set. Our mission is to provide great jobs to talented people, no matter where they are located.

Our client is a super-intelligent finance platform, a real-time data transformer that turns messy streams (bank feeds, invoices, emails, API events) into perfectly structured records and investor-grade clarity.

Role Overview:
As a DevOps Engineer, you would work shoulder-to-shoulder with the development team, review every infrastructure decision, and step in as the full owner the day the platform is released.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Review & sign off on every AWS resource (Lambda, RDS/Postgres, S3, EventBridge, VPC, IAM, KMS) that the Toptal team codes. Block console clicks and own the modules post-launch.
  • Validate VPCs, peering, VPNs, routing, and private endpoints. Ensure least-privilege paths and document the topology for future scale.
  • Audit IAM policies, encryption settings, secret rotation, and audit logging. Confirm they hit GSI's security baseline.
  • Evaluate & tune the ELK or Prometheus/Grafana stack Toptal deploys so alerts fire before users notice issues.
  • Confirm automated CVE scans, patch workflows, and incident-response runbooks, then run a tabletop drill.
  • Gather SOC 2 & ISO 27001 evidence (config snapshots, access logs), close gaps, and answer customer questionnaires.
  • Review GitHub Actions (or similar) pipelines‚Äîensure SAST/DAST/IaC scans and signed artifacts, then own and improve them.
  • Verify & test snapshots, cross-region replication, and restore run-books so finance data can't disappear.

Requirements

  • Terraform / Terragrunt for real workloads
  • AWS expertise across compute, storage, and networking
  • Cloud-networking depth (VPC design, peering, VPN, routing)
  • Observability stacks (ELK, Prometheus/Grafana, or similar)
  • SOC 2 & ISO 27001 exposure‚Äîyou've lived under these frameworks
  • Vulnerability management & incident response (CVE scanning, patching, drills)
  • Availability to work with a 4‚Äî6 h overlap with New York time (UTC-8, UTC-3)

Benefits

  • Remote Working for US Company
  • Exposure to new technology & trends
  • Competitive USD Salary


About the company

Paired serves as your bridge to global career possibilities. We're dedicated to connecting you with esteemed US companies and offering remote work options. Your journey to a thriving international career starts here.
tecnologias: R, AWS, GitHub Actions, Terraform, AI, DevOps, REST, API, Git

descripcion:
Zippy was founded with one mission: to make getting a loan for a manufactured home simple, fast, and fully online. We believe modern manufactured homes are affordable, well-built, eco-friendly, and stylish, but finding a lender who understands this market can be challenging. That‚Äôs why Zippy focuses exclusively on manufactured home loans, offering a seamless, digital experience.

Headquartered in Dallas, TX, with an office in Tempe, AZ, Zippy provides home loans and insurance to manufactured home buyers throughout the United States. Our remote-first team is spread across cities like Dallas, Houston, Knoxville, Omaha, Philadelphia, Phoenix, and several other states and cities. Backed by institutional investors, we offer competitive pay, stock options, and excellent benefits. At Zippy, we pride ourselves on our commitment to finance happiness through the power of home. We are dedicated to enhancing consumers' financial outcomes and tackling the affordable housing crisis through cutting-edge technology and innovative solutions.

The Role

Zippy is looking for a hands-on, technically strong Senior DevOps Engineer to step into a high-impact role as we scale our infrastructure and DevOps practices. You‚Äôll be responsible for owning and evolving the systems that power our fully digital lending experience for manufactured homes. This is a highly collaborative and technical role with deep involvement in infrastructure, deployment pipelines, security, and automation.¬†

What You‚Äôll Do¬†

  • Own and evolve our infrastructure-as-code setup using Terraform and AWS.¬†

  • Improve CI/CD processes, observability, and security posture across environments.¬†

  • Maintain and enhance Docker-based deployments, orchestration, and performance & availability.¬†

  • Develop and manage internal tooling, scripts, and automation using Bash and other scripting languages.¬†

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with Engineering, Business Technology, and Product teams to enable fast and safe deployments.¬†

  • Help define best practices for DevOps at Zippy, including documentation, processes and procedures.¬†

  • Organize and document access controls, passwords, credentials, and infrastructure ownership.¬†

  • Serve as a technical expert and thought partner on system architecture, security, data pipelines, and scalability.¬†

What We‚Äôre Looking For¬†

  • 5+ years of experience in DevOps, SRE, or similar infrastructure engineering roles.¬†

  • Expert-level knowledge of Terraform and AWS, specifically ECS, Fargate, FSx, RDS & Aurora Serverless¬†

  • Experience working with and deploying Ruby on Rails applications.¬†

  • Expert proficiency with Docker and container-based development environments.¬†

  • Strong command-line experience and scripting in Bash.¬†

  • Strong GitHub experience, including workflows, permissions, and automation.¬†

  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, managing secure credentials, and SOC2 compliance and enforcement.¬†

  • Strong background in Data infrastructures, tooling, performance, and pipelines.¬†¬†

  • A pragmatic builder with a documentation-first mindset ‚Äî knows how to scale without chaos.¬†

  • Comfortable working independently and asynchronously in a remote-first startup.¬†

Bonus Points¬†

  • Experience mentoring or onboarding new DevOps engineers.¬†

  • Previous work in fast-moving startups with lean engineering teams.¬†

  • Exposure to security compliance or audit-ready environments.¬†

  • Experience with Python frameworks such as Django or Flask.¬†

  • Experience with DBT, Foreign Data Wrappers, data warehouses & data lakes.¬†

  • Experience with Postgres, MSSQL, Redis.¬†

  • Experience with Cloudflare CDN & WARP¬†

  • Broad experience with AWS platform including Glue, CodeBuild, EventBridge, ML & AI tools, etc¬†

Please note that we are currently only hiring candidates who reside in the following states: Arizona, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Indiana, Louisiana, Maryland, Michigan, Missouri, Montana, Nebraska, Nevada, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Oklahoma, Oregon, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, South Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, and Washington.

Total Rewards

At Zippy, we're passionate about creating a workplace where people love to work. We put a lot of heart into building and nurturing a company culture that not only supports our team but also inspires them to do their best work.

Our benefits and perks are always evolving, but here‚Äôs what we offer right now:

  • Competitive Compensation: We offer a competitive salary with the potential for annual bonuses and variable pay, depending on your skills and experience.

  • Equity for All: As a part of our commitment to shared success, all employees receive equity in the company, allowing you to share in the growth and achievements of Zippy.

  • Remote Work: Enjoy the flexibility of working from home in a dynamic, remote-first environment.

  • Comprehensive Health Coverage: We provide medical, dental, and vision insurance, along with company-subsidized benefits like STD, LTD, and life insurance for you and your family.

  • Flexible Spending Accounts: Take advantage of medical & dependent care FSAs to help manage your expenses.

  • Training & Licensing Support: We invest in your professional growth with resources for training and licensing.

  • Paid Time Off: We offer generous PTO‚Äîand we encourage you to use it!

  • Wellbeing Programs: Access a variety of wellbeing resources, including Headspace, Gympass+, Fetch, Spring Health, SoFi, Perkspot, Ladder, and more through our Sequoia Wellbeing Programs.

  • Parental Leave: We provide paid parental leave to support you and your growing family.

  • No Meeting Wednesdays: Enjoy a mid-week break from meetings to focus and recharge.

  • Vibrant Slack Community: Engage with colleagues in our lively remote Slack community, featuring fun channels that connect people around shared interests like travel, pets, sports, food, and more.

  • Career Growth: We believe in promoting from within, offering you opportunities to grow your career with us.

Beyond the tangible benefits:

  • Core Values: At the heart of everything we do are our core values: Lead with Passion, Own It, Build a Better Way, Results Driven, and The Golden Rule. These values guide our decisions, shape our culture, and inspire us to achieve our best every day.

  • Join a Growing Team: Be part of a dynamic team at a pivotal moment in Zippy‚Äôs growth, where every contribution makes a significant impact.

  • Innovative Work: Collaborate with sharp, passionate teammates to tackle unique challenges in the Manufactured Housing market, positioning our product as a top-tier lending solution.

  • Supportive Culture: You‚Äôll be welcomed into a collaborative environment that fosters camaraderie, respect, and a deep sense of belonging.

  • Diversity & Inclusion: We‚Äôre committed to empowering a diverse and inclusive workforce, celebrating our differences, and ensuring everyone feels safe to bring their whole selves to work.

  • Inspirational Leadership: Work alongside leaders who are not only approachable but also dedicated to providing guidance, mentorship, and support to help you succeed.

  • Meaningful Impact: Be part of a mission-driven team that‚Äôs making housing more affordable for everyone, helping prospective buyers secure fast and simple online loans to purchase manufactured homes. By joining Zippy you will help improve the lives of over 22 million Americans who live in manufactured homes today.

Zippy is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate based on race, color, national origin, religion, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, disability status, or marital status. If you are excited about the role but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply. Nothing in this job posting should be construed as an offer or guarantee of employment.

You‚Äôll play a critical role in maintaining and optimizing our infrastructure at scale, ensuring robust security standards (including SOC 2 compliance), and driving cloud cost efficiency.

Manage and scale cloud infrastructure using Terraform across AWS and GCP.

descripcion:
We are seeking skilled and experienced QA Automation Developer Services to support the Client Integration Team. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing automated tests for API and integration services, execute the tests, develop test automation mechanisms (pipelines, etc.) and execute some manual tests where automation is not present or difficult. Additionally, the candidate will be responsible for coordinating test execution with different application owners across the teams.

The ideal candidate will have strong technical skills on the Microsoft Azure environment, hands-on development experience with integration platform technologies (API management), API design and development (REST/JSON, SOAP/XML), resilient asynchronous loosely coupled designs that leverage event and service bus technologies, practical experience of DevSecOps principles such as Continuous Integration/Deployment (CI/CD), SCA, SAST security analysis tools, and other code analysis services, strong agile delivery practices and great problem-solving skills.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Develop and implement QA automation strategies for Microsoft Azure API and BizTalk applications and other integration services.

  • Execute tests and be responsible for test execution for our different API services and ensure services are running as expected. Troubleshoot issues.

  • Perform manual testing where automation is difficult to ensure comprehensive coverage.

  • Coordinate with different application owners to ensure testing is done adequately and efficiently and is align with change management process.

  • Participate in daily huddles and weekly planning meetings to align on project goals and progress.

  • Ensure compliance with company guidelines and standards.

  • Participate in Technical Community of Practice activities such as knowledge-sharing and development of standards

Skills Required:

  • Experience on API testing tools such as Postman, Swagger, Azure Pipelines, and Robot Framework for API testing automation and API related technologies such as REST/JSON, SOAP/XML.

  • Hands on experience with Microsoft Azure and its relevant build, deployment, automation, integration, DevSecOps, networking, and security technologies in cloud and hybrid environments.

  • Experience developing Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) practices.

  • Hands-on experience with Microsoft .NET

  • Experience in scripting such as YAML, Powershell, etc

  • Post-secondary degree in a related field such as Computer Science or Engineering.

  • At least 5 years of experience in software development, with proven experience in software integration.

Assets:

  • Experience in API virtualization and DevOps an asset.

descripcion:
Overview:

Rescale is the leader in enterprise big compute and is one of the fastest growing tech companies in Silicon Valley. Our customers range from disruptive and innovative startups to leading global automotive manufacturers. Our dynamic team is welcoming, collaborative and diverse. Becoming a part of the Rescale team means that you are part of the next generation in big compute and cloud HPC. You will become part of the disruption which is turning traditional HPC on its head.

We are looking for a motivated Network & Systems Administrator to join our dynamic IT team. This role is ideal for someone with 1-5 years of experience in setting up and maintaining both cloud and on-premise networks and VPNs. The successful candidate will also have a foundational understanding of Linux systems administration and security patching. As part of the role, you will interact directly with customers and engineers, collaborating with their network and security teams to resolve issues and implement solutions.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Network & VPN Setup and Maintenance [~25% of time]:

    • Assist in configuring, maintaining, and troubleshooting cloud and on-premise network infrastructures, including Virtual Private Networks (VPNs).

    • Monitor and ensure the stability and performance of network connections and services.

    • Be a part of a 24/7 on call rotation for supporting customer VPNs.

      • Will be dependent on team size, but ideally 2 or 3 days on, and then a break corresponding to the size of the members sharing the on call rotation.

  • Customer Interaction [~20% of time]:

    • Communicate directly with customers to understand their network and system needs, troubleshooting any issues they face with networks or systems.

    • Collaborate with customer network and security teams to ensure smooth operation and resolve any technical challenges.

  • Documentation & Reporting [~10% of time]:

    • Maintain detailed documentation of network configurations, VPN setups, system patches, and security protocols.

    • Provide regular updates and status reports to both internal teams and customers.

  • Linux Systems Administration [~20% of time]:

    • Perform routine administrative tasks on Linux systems, including updates, backups, and general system maintenance.

    • Assist in setting up and managing servers and services in a Linux environment, via tools like Terraform and Ansible.

  • Security and Vulnerability Management [~25% of time]:

    • Assist in applying patches and updates to systems to ensure they are secure and protected from vulnerabilities.

    • Stay informed about the latest security threats and ensure systems are hardened against potential risks.

Qualifications & Skills:

  • Experience:

    • 1+ years of experience in network administration, system administration, or related fields.

    • Terraform and Ansible are a plus.

  • Technical Skills:

    • Basic knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, etc.) and on-premise network setups.

    • Familiarity with VPN technologies and configurations (IPSec, OpenVPN, AWS Site to Site VPN, Cisco IOS, etc.).

    • Basic Linux system administration experience (RHEL, CentOS, etc).

    • Understanding of security best practices and patch management processes.

  • Communication Skills:

    • Comfortable interacting with customers, both technical and non-technical.

    • Ability to work collaboratively with customer teams and internal staff.

  • Problem-Solving:

    • Ability to troubleshoot network and system issues and propose effective solutions.

  • Bonus Skills:

    • Experience with network monitoring and security tools.

    • Knowledge of firewall configurations and other network security technologies.

    • Modern DevOps practices

    • Kubernetes Administration

Rescale is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age. As part of our standard hiring process for new employees, employment with Rescale will be contingent upon successful completion of a comprehensive background check. ¬†
tecnologias: R, AWS, Azure, Kubernetes, Terraform, Ansible, AI, DevOps, API, Linux

We Make Remote Work Remarkable ‚Ä¢ TopTalent from LatAm

Hello! We are GoFasti, a Talent-as-a-Service. GoFasti bridges the gap between world-class developers and designers from LatAm and first-class companies around the globe.

We need an English-fluent Infrastructure and Operations Engineer, based in Latin America, available to work remotely.

Are you the one we are looking for?

Responsibilities:

  • Build and maintain robust, scalable CI/CD workflows using GitHub Actions, Docker, and AWS services to streamline deployments and reduce downtime.
  • ¬†Oversee and optimize AWS environments, ensuring reliability, scalability, and cost efficiency of cloud-based services.
  • ¬†Implement and manage network configurations including VPNs, firewalls, IP addressing, load balancing, and secure access protocols.
  • ¬†Ensure infrastructure meets security and privacy standards through proactive hardening, access control, and secure deployment strategies.
  • ¬†Perform basic SQL database administration, including monitoring, performance tuning, backups, and data recovery processes.
  • ¬†Use AWS CloudFormation to automate infrastructure provisioning and support serverless deployments using AWS Lambda and related services.
  • ¬†Set up and maintain observability tools such as CloudWatch, Prometheus, and Grafana to proactively detect and resolve system issues.
  • ¬†Perform advanced Linux system administration, including updates, configuration, performance optimization, and security enhancements.
  • ¬†Work cross-functionally to support application deployments, troubleshoot issues, and ensure alignment between infrastructure and development efforts.

Requirements:

  • 3+ years of experience in infrastructure, DevOps, or systems engineering roles.
  • Proficient in AWS services including EC2, S3, Lambda, CloudFormation, IAM, VPC, and related cloud-native tools.
  • Strong experience with CI/CD pipelines, particularly using GitHub Actions and Docker in production environments.
  • Solid understanding of networking concepts, protocols, and tools (VPN, DNS, firewalls, load balancers, etc.).
  • Hands-on experience with Linux systems administration, shell scripting, and performance tuning.
  • Experience with observability tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, and AWS CloudWatch.
  • Familiarity with SQL databases and basic database administration tasks.
  • Security-minded approach to infrastructure design and deployment.
  • Experience with serverless architectures and automation using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) principles.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently and collaboratively across teams.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Compensation:

  • The Salary range offered for this position varies from (USD) $2,000 - $3,000 per month, depending on seniority and skillset.
  • This position is for an independent contractor,¬†through a payroll platform.
  • The talent will work REMOTELY allocated at our client.¬†

Here are the steps for this process:

Application review/approval > Screening interview with GoFasti's team > We build and send your profile to our client > Profile review/approval by client > Interview with the client > Hiring and onboarding.¬†

¬†

Once you apply for the job, our team will review your resume. If it meets the requirements, we will contact you and move forward in the process.¬†

Note for Candidates Approached Directly:
If you were contacted directly by a member of our team and are interested in this opportunity, please do not apply through this link. Instead, reach out to the person who contacted you to coordinate a meeting.

Thank you!

¬†
JOB OVERVIEW
JOB TITLEAzure Cloud Operations Engineer
DIVISION/DEPARTMENTIT
LOCATIONRemote
REPORTS TO:Technical Lead/Project Manager
JOB SUMMARY
We are seeking a skilled Azure Cloud Operations Engineer to join our development team and take ownership of the infrastructure, performance, security, and compliance of our cloud-based applications hosted in both Azure Commercial and Azure Government environments.

This role spans the management of Azure services, cloud cost optimization, regulatory compliance, and support for DevOps pipelines. The ideal candidate is hands-on, detail-oriented, and experienced in securing and maintaining highly available systems that serve federal and commercial clients.
DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
The Azure Cloud Operations Engineer will:
  • Monitor and manage Azure cloud environments and services including, but not limited to, VMs, App Services, Redis, Service Bus, Azure Functions, Logic Apps, and storage accounts.
  • Optimize performance, scalability, and cost across both single-tenant and multi-tenant deployments.
  • Implement and enforce security best practices; monitor and respond to vulnerabilities and incidents.
  • Ensure and maintain compliance with current standards (e.g., SOC2) and support the implementation of future frameworks (e.g. FedRamp).
  • Support CI/CD processes in Azure DevOps, including both creation and maintenance of pipelines.
  • Execute application deployments as part of the release process, following established schedules and procedures.
  • Collaborate with developers and stakeholders to ensure system reliability, scalability, and secure configuration.
  • Maintain accurate documentation for infrastructure, processes, and compliance requirements.
  • Occasionally provide after-hours support for critical deployments or incident resolution.
EDUCATION & CERTIFICATIONS
  • Bachelor's Degree in a technical field or equivalent work experience is preferred.
KNOWLEDGE & EXPERIENCE
Primary Skills
  • U.S. Citizenship and U.S. residency required.
  • 3‚Äì5+ years of Azure experience, including at least 1‚Äì2 years working in Azure Government environments.
  • Strong hands-on experience with core Azure services and Azure governance tools.
  • Solid knowledge of cloud security and compliance practices in regulated environments.
  • Experience working with .NET-based applications in Azure environments.
  • Proficiency with scripting and infrastructure-as-code tools (PowerShell, ARM/Bicep, or Terraform).
  • Familiarity with Redis, Azure Service Bus, Azure Functions, and Logic Apps.
  • Experience supporting both single-tenant and multi-tenant architectures.

Preferred Skills
  • Azure Administrator or Azure DevOps Engineer certifications.
  • Experience with SOC2 audits, FedRAMP compliance, or other regulatory frameworks.
  • Background in supporting applications in federal or government contractor settings.
SKILLS & ABILITIES
  • Need to have the capacity to break down complex problems into smaller, manageable components and analyze the root causes and potential solutions.
  • Have the aptitude to work effectively with others, seek input and feedback and leverage collective knowledge and skills to solve problems as a team.
  • The skill to think outside the box, generate new ideas and approach problems from unique perspectives to find innovative solutions.
  • The capability to assess available options, weigh their pros and cons and make informed decisions that best address the problem at hand.
  • Be ambitious and self-directed with excellent communication skills.

¬†

Experienced

IntegriChain is uniquely focused on connecting the commercial, financial, and operational dimensions of drug access and profitability. We‚Äôve brought together technology, data, consulting, and outsourcing capabilities that span contracting and pricing, channel management, patient support, and gross-to-net finance.

We are headquartered in Philadelphia, PA (USA), with offices in: Ambler, PA (USA); Pune, India; and¬†Medell√≠n, Colombia. For more information, visit¬†www.integrichain.com, or follow us on Twitter @IntegriChain¬†and¬†LinkedIn.



Job Description
